outline_sections.title: Epidemiology and Viral Etiology of Conjunctivitis
outline_sections.goal: Establish the scope of viral conjunctivitis as a public health concern, identify major viral pathogens (adenovirus, herpes simplex virus), characterize transmission dynamics, incubation periods, and communicability rates, and define the population at risk.

outline_sections.title: Pathophysiology and Corneal Involvement
outline_sections.goal: Explain the mechanistic basis for viral conjunctivitis progression, describe how viral infection leads to corneal complications including keratitis, punctate keratitis, and corneal ulceration, and detail the inflammatory cascade responsible for tissue damage.

outline_sections.title: Clinical Presentation and Acute Manifestations
outline_sections.goal: Characterize the spectrum of symptoms and signs in viral conjunctivitis, distinguish viral from bacterial presentations, document the natural disease course, and establish diagnostic criteria for identifying corneal involvement early.

outline_sections.title: Long-Term Sequelae and Vision Outcomes
outline_sections.goal: Synthesize evidence on chronic complications, incidence of permanent vision impairment, corneal scarring, and chronic conjunctivitis development; establish prognosis for complete resolution versus persistent symptoms; quantify the proportion of patients experiencing long-term ocular morbidity.

outline_sections.title: Clinical Management Strategies and Therapeutic Interventions
outline_sections.goal: Review evidence-based treatment approaches including supportive care, corticosteroid use, antivirals, and pain management; evaluate efficacy in preventing complications and long-term vision loss; address controversies regarding short-term corticosteroid application in acute infection.

outline_sections.title: Quality of Life, Economic Burden, and Public Health Implications
outline_sections.goal: Assess the impact of acute and chronic viral conjunctivitis on patient functioning, work productivity, and healthcare costs; examine transmission control strategies and their role in reducing community-level ocular morbidity; discuss ethical considerations in balancing contagion prevention with patient care.

outline_sections.title: Future Directions and Research Gaps
outline_sections.goal: Identify unresolved questions regarding risk factors for severe disease, long-term corneal remodeling, novel preventive strategies, and the role of emerging viral pathogens; synthesize findings and articulate the clinical and public health significance of understanding viral conjunctivitis sequelae.
